body.p:
Sept 23d 1863
To his Excellency The Governor of Ky

Your petition Richard Durbin states at the September ^term^ Inst of the Edmondson Equity & Criminal Court he was found guily of Selling Spiritious Liquor to a minor He states that a neighbor has sent a boy for a quart of whisky & your petitioner sent it to him by said boy, & for that he was fined $50 & costs
your peitioner states he is poor has a large family to support & pray your honors clemency in the remission of said fine & will ever pray
The undersigned states that they are neighbors of Richard Durbin & that they believe the statements made by him are true & they Join him in his prayer for the remission of said fine

J E Bacon P J C C C
Jas Walker Jus
J. P. Vincent J P E C
W Haslip
S Brooks
T R zetter
James Sock
Aron Lawson
P H Sohan P. M
Bradley Meredith
James Vincent
Direct to Bee Spring Ky
I certify that I am personly acquainted with those men and now them to be Honerable union men and I Join Mr Durbin in his Prayer for Remission of Sd fine F. Meredith P M

The undersigned States he was counsel for the petitioner that upon trial of the case it was proven by Wm Jones that his father and a neighbour sent him to the house of the petitioner for a quart of whickey which he got and paid for and took home without drinking any of it to this father,s that he was a minor this is substantially the case Mr Durbin is poor & ill able to pay the fine I hope Executive clemency will be extended he deserves it

Edmonson
Remit all except costs & fees --
T E Bramlette
Oct 5th/63
vs Richd Durbin
